title.narrative: OUTP 3.1: Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) SERVICE DELIVERY

description.narrative: Output 3.1 Enhanced support for children, adolescent girls and families leading to sustained use of safe drinking water, adoption of adequate sanitation and good hygiene practices., which contributes to Environmental Sustainability, Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 3: By 2020, Zimbabweans have increased and equitable use of safe drinking water, sanitation and improved hygiene practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.1 Enhanced support for children, adolescent girls and families leading to sustained use of safe drinking water, adoption of adequate sanitation and good hygiene practices.

description.narrative: UNICEF reached a total of 120,557 people in rural areas and 23,608 in urban areas, including persons with disabilities, with safe drinking water in non-emergency settings. 899 Community Health Clubs and Sanitation Action Groups in 12 rural districts helped to support the achievement of 6,413 households adopting safe sanitation facilities though the construction of 6,404 self-funded latrines. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:31/12/2019
